New Records: South Africa maintained their unbeaten record in chasing in the World Cup
Mohammad Rizwan became the third Pakistani wicket-keeper to reach 2000 ODI runs
Key Match Events: South Africa won by 1 wicket (with 16 balls remaining)
Haris Rauf took a sensational diving return catch with his left hand to leave South Africa nine down
Shadab Khan and Saud Shakeel added 84 for the sixth wicket
Babar Azam reached his 50 in 64 balls, but was dismissed soon after
Rizwan was dismissed by Coetzee after a swipe at a short ball
Jansen and close-in catchers worked well for South Africa, with Heinrich Klaasen at a deep slip/short third position
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan won the toss and chose to bat first
South Africa made three changes, with Bavuma, Shamsi and Ngidi coming in, with Hendricks, Coetzee and Rabada missing out
Pakistan made two changes, with Hasan Ali ruled out due to fever and Mohammad Nawaz returning
Post-Match Reflections: Temba Bavuma admitted they would also have batted first
Pakistan's inability to convert starts at this World Cup - by Shiva Jayaraman
Shadab Khan spoke about the workload of being an allrounder
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa were clinical with the ball in the absence of Kagiso Rabada
Tabraiz Shamsi and Marco Jansen lit South Africa's bowling attack up, taking seven of the 10 wickets
Pakistan's batting line up struggled to reproduce their efforts in other matches in spite of getting starts
